result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary A. Sinnen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 Fine Plus Costs. **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
_________________________________

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
_________________________________

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
_________________________________

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
_________________________________

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
_________________________________

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
_________________________________

timeConds.notes: To commence on or before 11/8/16 at 8:00am and with work release privileges.
Complete 80 Hours of Community Service Work during the period of probation ordered. WITHOUT buy out option.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachary A. Sinnen in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 8:30 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing.
8:31 a.m. - Atty. Steen makes a record as to the agreement and informs the Court that they are prepared to argue for expunction.
8:32 a.m. - ADA Herrmann responds that there was no firm agreement as to expunction, and will not take a position on this issue. 
8:33 a.m. - Court addresses Defendant and goes over rights/plea questionnaire/maximum penalties. Defendant responds to Court's questions.

Defendant enters GUILTY PLEA ON COUNT #1; Counts #2 & #3 are dismissed and read-in. Parties stipulate to factual basis. 
Court gives warnings as to voting rights, deportation, and firearms.
8:37 a.m. - Court turns to sentencing and addresses the State as to expungment. Record made by ADA Herrmann as to criminal record and sentencing agreement.
8:39 a.m. - Argument by Atty. Steen as to expunction.
8:46 a.m. - Defendant makes a statement/apology to the Court, and responds to Court's questions
8:49 a.m. - Court makes a record as to sentencing guidelines/factors/review of character letters. Court finds joint recommendation is fair and appropriate and adopts the agreement. As to expunction, Court makes a record and finds that based upon the Defendant's prior record/criminal history expungment is not appropriate in this case, and denies the request for expunction.

Parties have nothing further.

SENTENCE: **SEE ATTACHED PLEA AGREEMENT.**

Court in recess @ 8:55 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Zachary A. Sinnen in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Not guilty plea and trial reserved. Motion deadline prior to status hearing on February 25, 2016.

Defendant Zachary A. Sinnen in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter before the Court for preliminary hearing, but defendant wishes to waive the hearing. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant. Information filed - reading waived. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
